item.title: Blood for a Silver Dollar
item.description: Blood for a Silver Dollar, also known as One Silver Dollar, is a 1965 Italian-French Spaghetti Western film directed by Giorgio Ferroni, written by Giorgio Stegani and Ferroni and starring Giuliano Gemma and Ida Galli.

item.title: California
item.description: California is a 1977 Italo-Spanish spaghetti western film directed by Michele Lupo. The film was generally well received by critics and obtained a good commercial success at Italian box office.

item.title: The Dirty Outlaws
item.description: The Dirty Outlaws, also known as Big Ripoff, King of the West and The Desperado, is a 1967 Italian spaghetti western starring Andrea Giordana.

item.title: Sundance and the Kid
item.description: Sundance and the Kid is the American release title of Vivi o, preferibilmente, morti, a 1969 Spaghetti Western comedy directed by Duccio Tessari and starring Giuliano Gemma, Nino Benvenuti, and Sydne Rome. The film is also known as Alive or Preferably Dead and Sundance Cassidy and Butch the Kid.

item.title: Wanted
item.description: Wanted is an Italian western film released in 1967. It was directed by Giorgio Ferroni and starring Giuliano Gemma, Teresa Gimpera, and Nello Pazzafini. Gemma made two more westerns directed by Ferroni, with similar plots, where his character likewise carried the first name "Gary".

item.title: Fasthand
item.description: Fasthand is a 1973 Italian-Spanish Spaghetti Western film directed by Frank Bronston and starring Alan Steel, William Berger and Frank Braña.

item.title: Death Sentence
item.description: Death Sentence is a 1968 spaghetti western directed by Mario Lanfranchi and starring Richard Conte.

item.title: For a Few Extra Dollars
item.description: For a Few Extra Dollars, also known as Fort Yuma Gold and Die Now, Pay Later, is a 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Giorgio Ferroni.

item.title: A Bullet for Sandoval
item.description: A Bullet for Sandoval is a 1969 spaghetti western film. It is a co-production between Italy and Spain. The film was generally well received by critics. For years, it was thought that famed Italian horror film director Lucio Fulci directed this western, but that was later disputed by the film's lead star George Hilton.

item.title: Find a Place to Die
item.description: Find a Place to Die (1968) is a spaghetti western starring Jeffrey Hunter and Pascale Petit. It was co-written and directed by Giuliano Carnimeo with sequences directed by Hugo Fregonese who also produced the film.
